OptimalBinningWoE 0.1.0
  • Reference

Generates a Gains Table from the results of optimal binning

OptimalBinningGainsTable.Rd

This function takes the result of the optimal binning process and generates a detailed gains table. The gains table includes metrics such as the Weight of Evidence (WoE), Information Value (IV), cumulative positive and negative percentages, Kolmogorov-Smirnov (KS) statistic, odds ratio, lift, and Gini contribution for each bin.

Usage

OptimalBinningGainsTable(binning_result)

Arguments

binning_result

A list containing the binning results, which must include a data frame with the following columns: "bin", "count", "count_pos", "count_neg", and "woe".

Value

A data frame containing the following columns for each bin:

  • bin: The bin labels.

  • count: Total count of observations in the bin.

  • pos: Count of positive events in the bin.

  • neg: Count of negative events in the bin.

  • woe: Weight of Evidence (WoE) for the bin.

  • iv: Information Value (IV) contribution for the bin.

  • total_iv: Total Information Value (IV) across all bins.

  • cum_pos: Cumulative count of positive events up to the current bin.

  • cum_neg: Cumulative count of negative events up to the current bin.

  • pos_rate: Rate of positive events within the bin.

  • neg_rate: Rate of negative events within the bin.

  • pos_perc: Percentage of positive events relative to the total positive events.

  • neg_perc: Percentage of negative events relative to the total negative events.

  • count_perc: Percentage of total observations in the bin.

  • cum_count_perc: Cumulative percentage of observations up to the current bin.

  • cum_pos_perc: Cumulative percentage of positive events up to the current bin.

  • cum_neg_perc: Cumulative percentage of negative events up to the current bin.

  • cum_pos_perc_total: Cumulative percentage of positive events relative to total observations.

  • cum_neg_perc_total: Cumulative percentage of negative events relative to total observations.

  • odds_pos: Odds of positive events in the bin.

  • odds_ratio: Odds ratio of positive events compared to the total population.

  • lift: Lift of the bin, calculated as the ratio of the positive rate in the bin to the overall positive rate.

  • ks: Kolmogorov-Smirnov statistic, measuring the difference between cumulative positive and negative percentages.

  • gini_contribution: Contribution to the Gini coefficient for each bin.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
binning_result <- OptimalBinning(target, feature)
gains_table <- OptimalBinningGainsTable(binning_result)
} # }
